casebody.data:
L. R. CONNETT & COMPANY, Inc., Libelant-Appellee, v. Steam Tugs THE SENATOR RICE and THE HERCULES, Their Engines, etc., Cornell Steamboat Company, Claimant-Appellant, The Steamer Lexington, Her Engines, etc., Colonial Navigation Company, Claimant-Appellee. CORNELL STEAMBOAT COMPANY, Libelant-Appellant, v. THE Steamer LEXINGTON, Her Engines, etc., Colonial Navigation Company, Claimant-Appellee. Nos. 7, 8. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. Oct. 19, 1931. Kirlin, Campbell, Hickox, Keating So McGrann, of New York City (Robert S. Erskine and Henry. P. Elliott, both of New York City, of counsel), for appellant. Burlingham, Veeder, Fearey, Clark So Hupper, of New York City (Chauncey I. Clark and P. Fearson Shortridge, both of New York City, of counsel), for claimantappellee. Macklin, Brown, Lenahan So Speer, of New York City (Horace L. Cheyney, of New York City, of counsel), for libelant-appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and SWAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Decision and decrees, 43 F.(2d) 719, affirmed.
